result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Barry E Brill in court, in custody by video conferencing.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court for Barry E Brill.  Attorney Samuel Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is set for trial. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 8, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 08:31 am.
Writ of Habeas Corpus
Case will remain assigned to Judge Koss after August 1, 2022.
letter regarding bond conditions
Request from defense to reset

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Barry E Brill not in court.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court for Barry E Brill. Defendant was present but taken in to custody by Kenosha officers. Attorney Johnson asks that the motion not be addressed today. Future dates remain. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

10:28am Court in session

Defendant Barry Brill present in court with attorney Carl Johnson. Zeke Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Matter before the Court is on the State's request to modify the bond based on a letter submitted by the Lake Geneva Police Dept

Defense has reviewed the motion, further argument. 
DA Wiedenfeld responds to Court's questions. 
Further argument & response by Atty Johnson
Further record by DA Wiedenfeld. 

Court will hold the State's motion in abeyance

Court will change the ally to pretrial services. Court is ordering pretrial services as a condition of bond only for this purpose. 

Court warns that Deft will be on a one strike only, the first time he violates, bond will be amended. 

Defense is asking for 90 days, Court will set out 60 days.

Record by Atty Johnson as to the modification regarding contact with his son. 
State is objecting to any contact with minors. 

Court is not granting Atty Johnson's motion.
Further record by Atty Johnson that Deft's ex-wife is willing to supervise contact between Deft & his son. 
Court makes further record. 
Court will allow supervised contact between the Deft & his son only by his ex-wife & she must be present in the same room as Deft & his son. Court will also allow phone contact between Deft & his son. 


10:57am Court in recess
Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Order for Protection
Proposed Order for Protection

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Barry E Brill in court.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court for Barry E Brill. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Motion to modify bond by the State. Defense is objecting to modifying bond. Defense is stipulating to protective order. Court grants State's motion for protective order. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Order for Substitution of Attorney
Order for Substitution of Attorney
Stipulation for Substitution of Counsel
Carl B. Johnson
Patrick K. Cafferty
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

AMENDMENT 4/1/2022: 
Court will allow supervised contact between the Deft & his son only to be supervised by his ex-wife & she must be present in the same room as Deft & his son. 
Court will also allow phone contact between Deft & his son. 
Deft must comply with pretrial services. Pretrial services to be the designated third party to monitor through Covenant Eyes. 


Court amends device prohibition subject to defendant agreeing to install Covenant eyes on only one device. LGPD is designated as a 3rd party to monitor.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH V.W. OR RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH ANY MINORS OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL CONTACT. NO POSSESSION OF ANY DEVICE THAT CAN ACCESS THE INTERNET. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Barry E Brill appeared in court, Attorney Jason David Luczak for Barry E Brill appeared in court. Letter received from LGPD and request from person who posted bond money for money to be returned. Attorney Luczak may need to withdraw due to conflict with defendant's wife. Defendant understands he may need to retain new counsel. Defendant's wife present in court. State is not taking a position on the return of bond money. Court is returning the bond money to person who posted. Cancel 3/23 date. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

02:15 PM (64-05) Defendant Barry E Brill in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State called to the stand as a witness Detective Kaitlin Tietz.
Kaitlin Tietz duly sworn and testified on direct examination of DA Wiedenfeld. Witness identified witness in court. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
2:19 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Luczak.
2:25 PM - Evidence is closed.
Argument by DA Wiedenfeld.
Arugment by Attorney Luczak.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges.
State is requesting 2 weeks for arraignment hearing.

  Arraignment scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
